item.title: [HBASE-12569] Control MaxDirectMemorySize in the same manner as heap size
item.description:
It would make it much easier on us if we could manage MaxDirectMemorySize in the same way as heap. This patch allows that to happen.

Note: I have not tested the *.cmd modifications as I don't have a Windows box (at the moment, can test at home) but look like they should work (famous last words).

I just hit this issue in an older version. In the older versions the HBASE_OFFHEAPSIZE was never getting used at all.
So just in case some one is trying to set MaxDirectMemory for offheap bucketCache that does not have this JIRA's fix


# export HBASE_OPTS="$HBASE_OPTS -XX:MaxDirectMemorySize=SET_THIS_TO_HOW_MANY_GIGS_OF_OFFHEAP"

thinking that setting HBASE_OFFHEAPSIZE would help to control the maxDirectMemory size based on the reference here
http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#perf.reading. Ensure that you set SET_THIS_TO_HOW_MANY_GIGS_OF_OFFHEAP or directly use export HBASE_OPTS="$HBASE_OPTS -XX:MaxDirectMemorySize=8G option.
Just adding for reference.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Adds new HBASE_OFFHEAPSIZE environment variable to ./bin/hbase. Set the max offheap memory java will request with this one variable. It combines with HBASE_HEAPSIZE to determine the max amount of ram that the JVM can request.
